channel.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
channel.description:
We are super excited to launch [Drafts Web Capture](https://docs.getdrafts.com/docs/extensions/web-capture), a new way to capture text to your Drafts library, from any modern web browser, on any platform!
## What is Drafts Web Capture?
Drafts Web Capture is a web page that integrates directly with your Drafts iCloud storage, allowing the creation of drafts from any web browser on any platform. Key use cases for Drafts Web Capture:
- **You are someplace you do not have access to the Drafts app directly.** On a Windows PC at work? Have an Android tablet? Now you can capture that idea directly to Drafts without pulling out your iPhone. - **You want to use Drafts as a bookmark library, read-it-later service, or general research tool to keep up with links and text quotes from web pages.** Combined with a bookmarklet (examples below), Draft Web Capture makes it smooth and easy to enable such workflows.
Drafts Web Capture should work in most modern browsers (Safari, Chrome, Firefox) on any platform (Windows, Linux, Android - as well as macOS, iOS). ## Intro Screencast
https://youtu.be/eoM8MhqApCc
## Ready to Get Started?
Ready to start using Drafts Web Capture:
- Head to [https://capture.getdrafts.com](https://capture.getdrafts.com) - Install example Bookmarklets, and get more details [at the User Guide](https://docs.getdrafts.com/docs/extensions/web-capture).

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: sylumer
item.description:
The issue is occurring for iCloud login, so I would try clearing any cookies associated with that domain too. In fact, I would just clear out any Apple domain cookies just to be doubly sure - but I’m not convinced it would be necessary.

Also do clear the browser cache in case it is some temporary file that is persisting and thwarting the login effort.

CLEAR YOUR CACHE – 9 Jun 17

Clear your cache in Safari (Mac Os X/macOS)

♥ That´s how you do it: Delete temporary stored data (cache) in your Safari browser on your Apple Computer (Mac OsX / macOS)

Read full topic

I have disabled the shields for the capture.drafts and apple id.

item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: sylumer
item.description:
So, you can login via other sessions which suggests you have some rogue profile setting or bad cookie. It would be worth trying to clear your cookies to see if that resolves the login loop.

The pop-up always going into new tabs; check your browser settings to see if you have something set to always open in new tabs rather than new windows.

Read full topic
item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: satchel
item.description:
1. I have used both; neither work
  2. I am not currently running ad blockers (although plan to add some)
  3. Same problem: I login, it redirects to icloud, then I go back to that same page
  4. It works in Incognito: I set on pop up but it opens a separate full tab
  5. It works for Firefox sort of…I always use Pop up, but it just opens the drafts page as a separate tab.

Read full topic
item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: sylumer
item.description:
1. Which of the bookmarklets are you using?
  2. Does the other bookmarklet work for you?
  3. Have you tried disabling any ad blockers you might be running?
  4. What happens if you visit the https://capture.getdrafts.com page directly and login, rather than the bookmarklet?
  5. Do either of the bookmarklets, or the capture page work for you in a Chrome incognito session?
  6. Do either of the bookmarklets, or the capture page work for you in another browser (not Chrome) on the same device?
  7. Do either of the bookmarklets, or the capture page work for you in a Chrome browser on a different device?

Read full topic
item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: satchel
item.description:
Hi, yes, I have used the bookmarketlet and it has been failing consistently. So not sure how to troubleshoot it.

I basically grab the bookmarklet to my browser.

Then I click on it.

It asks to authenticate to iCloud.

After successfully doing so, it takes me back to the original page asking me to authenticate to iCloud.

Read full topic
item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: sylumer
item.description:
It is a web site and you can use a bookmarklet for it. There’s no extension, in fact, there’s nothing really to install.

Have you watched the video in the first post explaining how to access and use it? If you have, perhaps you could describe the steps you are following and the error you are encountering?

Read full topic

item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: agiletortoise
item.description:
No plans for that, but you might also look at automatic import. If you setup iCloud Drive on your Window machine, you can enable that and just save to text files in the Inbox and have them appear in Drafts. Lots of ways to automate saving to text files on Windows.

Read full topic
item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: belgarion
item.description:
This feature is very useful in Windows. I can finally drop text into Drafts in my work-issued Windows machine.

I’m exploring a way to have a web browser window configured to appear when I key in a Keyboard Shortcut

I’m wondering if there are any plans to make a simple window taskbar program that pops up, let me enter text and saves through Web Capture. Maybe an API for aspiring developers to do?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Andreas_Haberle
item.description:
I always said that Drafts is one of the very few real applications on iOS (not only an app) but now I have to find a new word for what Drafts is.

As a software engineer we may call it a ITE (integrated text enviroment) - thank you so much @agiletortoise

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: Blue
item.description:
THIS is the solution those of us with Windows desktop machines and iOS-running handsets have been asking for from writing apps… What’s odd is that I only speak to one other person regularly who uses Drafts and we were just talking at length this morning about this…

So I see it’s not Facebook or Alexa who’s been listening to my conversations all this time…But Drafts!!

Read full topic

agiletortoise:

Try to quit and re-launch Safari.

Didn’t need to in the end. I tried again now and it just worked.

Good stuff!

item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: RochelleB
item.description:
I am so happy about this, and it works great on my Android Pixel phone.

I prefer the Android OS for phones (ONLY for phones – you’ll have to pry my iPad out of my cold, dead hands). I’ve wished for an Android Drafts app since Drafts first came out for iOS. I’ve tried to think of some way to hack being able to capture text for Drafts via my Android phone. And now I can, no hack required!

I’ve already tried this and it works great. I have now bookmarked the URL to my Android home screen.

Thank you!

Read full topic
item.source: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser

item.title: ANN: Drafts Web Capture! Add to Drafts from any browser
item.dc:creator: TDK_SA90
item.description:
Only thing I’ve noticed is, that in Chrome(book), some of the Keyboard shortcuts listed at the bottom of the capture window, conflict with those in Chrome.

  • Shift+Ctrl+B shows/hides bookmarks bar
  • Shift+Ctrl+T duplicates the current tab
